title: Two fishing boats involved in separate accidents; several fishermen missing
byline: Two separate fishing boats, one departing from Dondra Fisheries Harbour and the other from the Kalutara area, were involved in an accident at sea.

title: WHO says all Covid-19 origin theories still open, after inconclusive study
byline: All hypotheses on how the Covid-19 pandemic began remain open, the World Health Organization said on Friday (Jun 27), following an inconclusive four-year investigation that was hamstrung by crucial information being withheld.

title: Congo and Rwanda sign a US-mediated peace deal aimed at ending decades of bloody conflict
byline: The Democratic Republic of Congo and Rwanda on Friday signed a peace deal facilitated by the U.S. to help end the decadeslong deadly fighting in eastern Congo while helping the U.S. government and American companies gain access to critical minerals in the region.

title: 8-year-old dies from electrocution at home
byline: An 8-year-old child has died after being electrocuted at a residence in the Sangilikandarawa area, within the Medawachchiya Police Division, said police.

title: White House wants to stop US funding for ‘war crimes’ investigations in countries including Sri Lanka
byline: The White House has recommended ending U.S. funding for nearly two dozen international programs that investigate war crimes and promote accountability in conflict zones — including Sri Lanka, Myanmar, Syria, Ukraine, and others.

title: Showers above 50mm expected in several areas
byline: Showers are expected at times in the Western, Sabaragamuwa and North-western provinces and in the Nuwara-Eliya, Kandy, Galle and Matara districts today (28), the Department of Meteorology stated.

title: Trump cuts off US trade talks with Canada, shattering optimism over tariff deals
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump abruptly cut off trade talks with Canada on Friday over its tax targeting U.S. technology firms, saying that it was a “blatant attack” and that he would set a new tariff rate on Canadian goods within the next week.

title: Validity period of Israel re-entry visas of Sri Lankans extended
byline: The re-entry visas of Sri Lankans hoping to return to Israel has been extended till July 31, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism stated.

title: Thai protesters call for Prime Minister Paetongtarn’s resignation
byline: Hundreds of protesters gathered in the Thai capital Bangkok on Saturday demanding the resignation of Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra, as her government faces rising anger over a border row with Cambodia.

title: President highlights the urgent need to upgrade country’s public transport system
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has highlighted the urgent need to elevate the country’s public transport system to a new level in order to address a range of pressing issues, including road accidents, traffic congestion, the high cost burden of vehicle imports and environmental concerns.

title: SSP Shani Abeysekara appointed as CID Director
byline: Senior Superintendent of Police (SSP) Shani Abeysekara has been appointed as the Director of the Criminal Investigation Department (CID), police stated.

title: Trump says Gaza ceasefire is possible within a week
byline: President Donald Trump said on Friday he believes it is possible that a ceasefire in the Gaza conflict between Israel and Iran-backed Hamas militants will be reached within a week.

title: No discussions with Sri Lanka on forming Commercial Duty Free Zone: Maldives
byline: Minister of Economic Development and Trade of the Maldives Mohamed Saeed has dismissed media reports that his country is in discussions with Sri Lanka to develop a commercial duty free zone.

title: Bodies of two fishermen found after boat capsize in seas off Galle
byline: Bodies of two fishermen who were reported missing after their boat capsized off the coast of Galle earlier today (28), have been recovered a short while ago, the Sri Lanka Navy has confirmed.

title: SLAF deploys helicopter in search of missing fishermen off Dondra & Kalutara
byline: The Defence Secretary of Sri Lanka has instructed the Sri Lanka Air Force (SLAF) to immediately deploy a Bell 412 helicopter and a SLAF Y-12 aircraft to carry out reconnaissance and rescue operations for fishermen who went missing following two separate fishing boat accidents at sea.

title: Venice expects to rake in over $1.1 billion from Bezos-Sanchez wedding
byline: Venice, Italy, can expect to reap a $1.1 billion reward from Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sanchez’s controversial, star-studded wedding, according to Italy’s Tourism Ministry.

title: 13 soldiers killed in a suicide attack in northwest Pakistan: officials
byline: A suicide attack killed 13 soldiers and wounded 29, including civilians, in northwestern Pakistan on Saturday, local government officials and police officers told AFP.

title: Do not fall prey to middlemen at passport office: Immigration Dept
byline: The Department of Immigration and Emigration has requested individuals arriving at its head office in Battaramulla not to fall prey to brokers in order to expedite the submission of passport applications.

title: Indian Coast Guard rescues three Sri Lankans near Tamil Nadu’s Dhanushkodi
byline: The Indian Coast Guard (ICG) has rescued three Sri Lankans who had been reportedly abandoned on a sandbar near Adam’s Bridge, off the coast of Dhanushkodi in Tamil Nadu.

title: Boat capsize in seas off Galle: Bodies of two fishermen found
byline: Bodies of two fishermen who were reported missing after their boat capsized off the coast of Galle earlier today (28), have been recovered a short while ago, the Sri Lanka Navy has confirmed.

title: Seat belts mandatory for bus drivers from July 1: NTC
byline: The National Transport Commission (NTC) has announced that it will be mandatory for bus drivers to wear seat belts starting from July 1, 2025.

title: Five arrested in connection with Anuradhapura shooting incident
byline: A total of five individuals have been arrested in connection with a shooting incident that occurred in Thirappane, Anuradhapura.

title: France bans smoking in beaches, in parks and bus shelters
byline: France will ban smoking on beaches and in parks, public gardens and bus shelters from Sunday (Jun 29), the government said.
